title: Amy Schumer slams Donald Trump over tweet mocking 'fake tears'
text:
Amy Schumer slams Donald Trump over tweet mocking 'fake tears' Amy Schumer has hit out at Donald Trump's 'fake tears' tweet about Chuck Schumer Credit: Barcroft / AP Mark Molloy 1 February 2017 • 9:45am 
A my Schumer has hit out at Donald Trump and his ‘cruel’ travel ban after the president accused her politician cousin Chuck Schumer of crying 'fake tears'. 
The American actress and comedian said the Senate minority leader “cannot act” in an Instagram post defending him against Trump’s suggestions. 
“I know Chuck Schumer and HE CANNOT act trust me. He can barely smile on cue,” she wrote. 
“He can't help but be transparent and genuine. He was hurt for those people and all the people facing such unconstitutional injustice.” A photo posted by @amyschumer on Jan 31, 2017 at 8:04am PST 
I n a passionate attack on Trump’s controversial policies, the 35-year-old also urged her followers “to fight this now and together”. 
“Trump is about to bombard us with so many awful decisions. His Supreme Court pick will be terrifying and he will try and stop same sex adoption and all our other nightmares. We can't get burnt out or overwhelmed and distracted. We need to stay focused and organised.” Nancy Pelosi and Fake Tears Chuck Schumer held a rally at the steps of The Supreme Court and mic did not work (a mess)-just like Dem party! — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 31, 2017 There are tears running down the cheeks of the Statue of Liberty tonight. pic.twitter.com/X6q40dMCsN — Chuck Schumer (@SenSchumer) January 27, 2017 
S he added: “A Muslim ban is so unconstitutional and cruel. They are good, hard working people and a refugee from the countries he isn't letting people in from have never committed any acts of terrorism on US soil. Never. 
“We need to fight this now and together. Call congress. Call the senate. We need to wake up and rise up together. People need our help.” 
Her politician cousin cried on camera during a heartfelt speech in which he called Trump’s executive order “mean-spirited and un-American”. 
Trump said in response: "I saw Chuck Schumer with fake tears. I'm going to ask him who was his acting coach. 
"There's about a five per cent chance they were real. I know him very well and if they were he's a different man. I don't see him as a crier." More
